title.narrative: Maldives - Pension and Social Protection Administration

description.narrative: Revised PDO: to support the implementation of the National Pension Act, to strengthen institutional capacity of key agencies responsible for implementing the National Pension Act, and to develop the processes and platforms required for the delivery of social protection programs.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :1 | Description :Take all such actions as are necessary to establish the MPAO by July 1, 2010 | Due Date:01-Jul-2010

Finance Agreement :2 | Description :Phase out the Government Provident Fund (GPF) in its current form in a timely manner includingthe issuance of detailed transition provisions | Due Date :31-May-2010

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2 Section V.2 of the Financing Agreement | Description :The Recipient to appoint an independentconsultant to carry out the technical assessment for Component E. | Due Date :15-Aug-2011

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2 Section V.3 of the Financing Agreement | Description :The Recipient to submit to the Association atechnical assessment report on the progress made by the Recipient in fulfilling the agreed actions identified under the technicalassessment of Compon | Due Date :31-Mar-2012

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2 Section V.4. of the Financing Agreement | Description :The Recipient to appoint an independentauditor to carry out the financial statement audit and special performance audit. | Due Date :31-Dec-2011

title.narrative: Generation of payroll data for civil service personnel used for assessing mandated contributions for the new pensions system.

target.value: 100% of GoM agencies in Male use HR module of PAS

actual.value: 118 out of 124 Male' based agencies have completed the HR/payroll module roll-out.

title.narrative: Development and implementation of new process for annuitization in MRPS.

target.value: Policy on annuitization evaluated by the MPAO Board

actual.value: An In-house phased withdrawal provisions developed; annuitization options explored but it was decided it was not viable given theprevailing market conditions.

title.narrative: Assessment of options for determination of disability and required systems

target.value: Disability administration provisions fully implemented; relevant staff trained

actual.value: Disability Act enacted; proposal for disability coding and administration developed and piloted in 5 of 7 provinces; NSPA stafftrained; and disability administration provisions being implemented.

title.narrative: Development of options and piloting of new approach to targeting of social benefits

target.value: New targeting system fully implemented for at least one social protection program

actual.value: Interim strategy for national targeting system defined; new targeting method applied to Single Parent Allowance Program; newtargeting system fully implemented for at least one SP program

title.narrative: Key Policies developed and adopted to facilitate MRPS implementation

target.value: Draft amendments to relevant laws in order to unify parallel pension system and rationalize benefits

actual.value: Investment policy adopted; regulation on participation of foreign workers adopted; strategy for self-employed in MRPS defined;amendments to relevant laws to unify parallel pension systems and rationalize benefits.

title.narrative: New Systems under MPAO operational, including the establishment of new office of the MPAO, governance structures, MIS and provisions for outsourcing.

target.value: Key GoM cash transfers administered through MPAO

actual.value: MPAO Board established; MPAO CEO and staff in place; MIS fully operational; complaints redressal mechanism established; and pensiontransfers administered through MPAO.

title.narrative: Regular reporting of contributions and balances to members, including recognition bonds (RB)

target.value: On-line access to individual accounts and complaints procedure fully implemented

actual.value: Online access to individual accounts and complaint redressal mechanism fully implemented.

title.narrative: Payout of accrued pension rights to public sector workers retiring during the project period

target.value: Payout of rights of all those retired between Oct 2013-Mar 2014 completed

actual.value: Payout of rights of all those retired between Oct 2013-Mar 2014 completed

title.narrative: Reporting and compliance procedures defined and implemented, including regular monthly reporting of basic pension benefits paid andcontributions collected

target.value: MPAO targets inspections on high risk compliance cases.

actual.value: Regular MPAO supervision carried out, compliance reports generated and monthly report of payments made.

title.narrative: Development and implementation of management information systems and processes for targeting, disability administration abd health insurance

target.value: New MIS systems and processes fully implemented.Relevant staff trained.Strategy for an integrated national social protectionsystem developed

actual.value: SP Information System (SPIS) developed, installed, and being tested; proxy means targeting mechanism built into SPIS; processes fortargeting of social assistance benefits and electricity subsidy developed; strategy for an integrated SP system being discussed

title.narrative: Progress in implementing MRPS, measured by the number of individual accounts opened and maintained by the new pension authority

actual.value: There are 117327 individual Retirement Saving Accounts and 83957 of them are active contributors.

title.narrative: Progress in implementing a new basic pension scheme measured by the number of payments made and by strengthening the automatic clawback mechanisms

target.value: Automatic linkages with all other pension programs to improve administration of claw-back

actual.value: 16073 beneficiaries receive payment of basic pension

title.narrative: Effective supervision by the CMDA of the pension program administration and framework for new investment instruments

target.value: Framework for new investment instruments defined and implemented

actual.value: CMDA Pension Supervision Department established; regulations for custodianship and asset management adopted; electronic reportingsystem defined; framework for new investment instruments defined.

title.narrative: Increased public awareness about the new pension system

target.value: Significant improvement in understanding of pension system as reflected in the end line survey

actual.value: Public awareness and education workshops and information campaigns carried out in all atolls; public web site established; twosurveys (carried out in 2010 and 2015) demonstrated increased awareness on pension.
